intro: Carpolobia alba var. zanguebarica, commonly known as the white-flowered carpolobia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pale white or cream-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a smooth texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
